Id.description: The ID of the virtual cluster, such as `ab4rp1abcs8xz47n3x0example` .

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the project, such as `arn:aws:emr-containers:us-east-1:123456789012:/virtualclusters/ab4rp1abcs8xz47n3x0example` .

EksInfo.description: The information about the Amazon EKS cluster.

ContainerInfo.description: The information about the container used for a job run or a managed endpoint.

Id.description:
The ID of the container cluster.

*Minimum* : 1

*Maximum* : 100

*Pattern* : `^[0-9A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9\-_]*`

Info.description: The information about the container cluster.

Type.description: The type of the container provider. Amazon EKS is the only supported type as of now.

ContainerProvider.description: The information about the container provider.

Namespace.description:
The namespaces of the EKS cluster.

*Minimum* : 1

*Maximum* : 63

*Pattern* : `[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?`

EksInfo.description: The information about the Amazon EKS cluster.

description: The `AWS::EMRContainers::VirtualCluster` resource specifies a virtual cluster. A virtual cluster is a managed entity on Amazon EMR on EKS. You can create, describe, list, and delete virtual clusters. They do not consume any additional resources in your system. A single virtual cluster maps to a single Kubernetes namespace. Given this relationship, you can model virtual clusters the same way you model Kubernetes namespaces to meet your requirements.

ContainerProvider.description: The container provider of the virtual cluster.

Name.description: The name of the virtual cluster.

SecurityConfigurationId.description: The ID of the security configuration.

Tags.description:
An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

For more information, see [Tag](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-resource-tags.html) .
